channel.title: Gawker Media Hacked, Warns Users to Change Passwords
channel.description:
http://www.pcworld.com/businesscenter/article/213392/gawker_media_hacked_warns_users_to_change_passwords.html
E-mail addresses and password details for 200,000 registered users of Gawker Media websites are now circulating on peer-to-peer networks after a weekend hack attack. The company warned users to change their passwords -- including on other sites, if they use the same passwords elsewhere.
[url=http://www.4shared.com/document/_q_aDdXW/parsed_db.html]parsed_db.txt[/url] (Username, Password and email) [url=http://www.4shared.com/document/u873OYUJ/dumb_passwords.html]dumb_passwords.txt[/url] [url=http://www.4shared.com/document/FFOPWnRv/gawker_accounts.html]gawker_accounts.txt[/url] [url=http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/6036819/Gawker_Sites_Hacked_Databases__amp__More]Torrent[/url] http://blogs.forbes.com/firewall/2010/12/13/the-lessons-of-gawkers-security-mess/?boxes=Homepagechannels

item.title: Gawker Media Hacked, Warns Users to Change Passwords
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

“On an interesting side note there are 2650 users in the database using the password “password” or “querty”. Of these users one is registered under a .gov email address, 3 are from a .mil addres and 52 are from .edu addresses.”

Read full topic
item.source: Gawker Media Hacked, Warns Users to Change Passwords

item.title: Gawker Media Hacked, Warns Users to Change Passwords
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Mopman:

… they didn’t hash+salt passwords?

My thoughts exactly.

lordbost:

They used http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_Encryption_Standard

Oh, well I’m glad they deemed security software from 1973 as secure enough for their users. :rolleyes:

There is never any reason to store a cleartext or even an encrypted password when you can just hash it (with salt!) and store it that way. It’s preferable to not even send the password over the wire by hashing it client-side and then sending that. This is what SMF does, for example.

edit:
Ahahahahaha, I had to look at the password file to see how stupid these people were, and, well, the user name says it all:
UltimateIdiot911 ::: qwerty ::: UltimateIdiot911@yahoo.com
Seriously? That is your password?..

Read full topic
item.source: Gawker Media Hacked, Warns Users to Change Passwords
